intro: Malapoenna guatemalensis, commonly known as the Guatemalan malapoenna, is a species of flowering plant native to the highlands of Guatemala. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of red and pink. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires a warm, humid climate. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in tropical gardens.
